intro: Trichosanthes edulis var. sativa, commonly known as the Chinese lantern gourd, is a flowering plant in the family Cucurbitaceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its distinctive, inflated, orange-colored fruits that resemble small lanterns. The plant produces yellow flowers and has a climbing habit, often supported by tendrils. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are cylindrical and also hairy. The fruit is edible when mature, though it is typically used in traditional Chinese medicine and culinary applications.
